description:
If there's no API doc sample for a specific XML api samples test yet, you get a traceback such as this:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 2170, in test_cells_list
    return self._verify_response('cells-list-resp', subs, response)
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 252, in _verify_response
    self._verify_something(subs, expected, sample_data)
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 215, in _verify_something
    result = self._pretty_data(data)   
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 84, in _pretty_data
    xml = etree.XML(data)
  File "lxml.etree.pyx", line 2949, in lxml.etree.XML (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:614
97)
  File "parser.pxi", line 1594, in lxml.etree._parseMemoryDocument (src/lxml/lxm
l.etree.c:91220)
  File "parser.pxi", line 1473, in lxml.etree._parseDoc (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:9
0037)
  File "parser.pxi", line 988, in lxml.etree._BaseParser._parseDoc (src/lxml/lxm
l.etree.c:86700)
  File "parser.pxi", line 565, in lxml.etree._ParserContext._handleParseResultDo
c (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:82553)
  File "parser.pxi", line 656, in lxml.etree._handleParseResult (src/lxml/lxml.e
tree.c:83538)
  File "parser.pxi", line 596, in lxml.etree._raiseParseError (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:82862)
XMLSyntaxError: Start tag expected, '<' not found, line 1, column 1
title: Generating XML API samples fails when file doesn't yet exist

comments.content:
If there's no API doc sample for a specific XML api samples test yet, you get a traceback such as this:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 2170, in test_cells_list
    return self._verify_response('cells-list-resp', subs, response)
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 252, in _verify_response
    self._verify_something(subs, expected, sample_data)
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 215, in _verify_something
    result = self._pretty_data(data)   
  File "/home/cbehrens/git/nova/openstack.git/nova/tests/integrated/test_api_sam
ples.py", line 84, in _pretty_data
    xml = etree.XML(data)
  File "lxml.etree.pyx", line 2949, in lxml.etree.XML (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:614
97)
  File "parser.pxi", line 1594, in lxml.etree._parseMemoryDocument (src/lxml/lxm
l.etree.c:91220)
  File "parser.pxi", line 1473, in lxml.etree._parseDoc (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:9
0037)
  File "parser.pxi", line 988, in lxml.etree._BaseParser._parseDoc (src/lxml/lxm
l.etree.c:86700)
  File "parser.pxi", line 565, in lxml.etree._ParserContext._handleParseResultDo
c (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:82553)
  File "parser.pxi", line 656, in lxml.etree._handleParseResult (src/lxml/lxml.e
tree.c:83538)
  File "parser.pxi", line 596, in lxml.etree._raiseParseError (src/lxml/lxml.etree.c:82862)
XMLSyntaxError: Start tag expected, '<' not found, line 1, column 1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbehrens

comments.content:
This is because of this code:

 236         try:
 237             with file(self._get_sample(name)) as sample:
 238                 sample_data = sample.read()
 239         except IOError:
 240             sample_data = "{}"

Later we try to use that as XML.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbehrens

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/18694
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/18694
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/cb5c61f66be54f5437ca78d62c51ed64aacc383e
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit cb5c61f66be54f5437ca78d62c51ed64aacc383e
Author: Chris Behrens <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Dec 27 22:20:19 2012 +0000

    Allow new XML API sample file generation
    
    When GENERATE_SAMPLES is used, it's supposed to generate the docs for
    you.  However, if there's no pre-existing XML doc sample, it fails due
    to bad handling of this case.
    
    Fixes bug 1094141
    
    Change-Id: I186d6ce78886e37a3fdd3268154872c99072fdca
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
